channel.title: Delphi help
channel.description:
I am having trouble designing a program which needs to do the following:
I imput numbers, and the program needs to calculate the mean, maximum, minimum and range. It also needs to be versitile enough to add a calculater, SD, median etc without major reconstruction.
I have been thinking for a while about how to go about doing it, does anybody have any ideas?
I was thinking that the user imputs the statistics, and the program stores them to 5 ariables, minimum, maximum, total, currentimput and samples.
Minimum- Starts at 0, when the user imputs a number it checks it against the current minimum, if the imputed number is less than the minimum, it replaces it. ( If currentimput is greater than minumum then replace) Maximim- Same as minimum but checking if the number is greater than the current maximum
Total- When the user imputs a number, it adds to the total
samples- When the user imputs a number, it adds 1 to the samples.
Currentimput- Stores the number which was just entered.
Its the best I can come up with, but I don't know how I would get the mean or SD.
